content:
Fan Cheng is a Ph.D. student in Statistics at Monash University, supervised by \
Rob J Hyndman and Anastasios Panagiotelis. My research interests include manifold learning, time series analysis, and statistical computing. I am currently working on a project about Manifold learning on empirical probability distributions.
summary:
Fan Cheng is a Ph.D. student in Statistics at Monash University, supervised by \
Rob J Hyndman and Anastasios Panagiotelis. My research interests include manifold learning, time series analysis, and statistical computing. I am currently working on a project about Manifold learning on empirical probability distributions.
title: Fan Cheng

content: This is a post about how to build your websites.
summary: This is a post about how to build your websites.
title: Building Website Using Blogdown, Hugo and Github Pages

content:
When you want to include a pdf file in your Rmarkdown post, here are the tips for you.
 If the file is from your online Github repo, you should first get the link for the file.  First click the PDF file in your Github repo. Then right click in the download button and copy the link by copy link address.
PDF from existing Github repo
 If it is a local file, just put it in the content/post/, static/ or static/courses/ folder.  Files from /content/post/ folder
Files from static/ folder
Files from static/courses/ folder
summary:
When you want to include a pdf file in your Rmarkdown post, here are the tips for you.
 If the file is from your online Github repo, you should first get the link for the file.  First click the PDF file in your Github repo. Then right click in the download button and copy the link by copy link address.
PDF from existing Github repo
 If it is a local file, just put it in the content/post/, static/ or static/courses/ folder.
title: How to Add Local or Online Files to a Rmarkdown Post
